forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog after 2am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. Northeast wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Partly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 10am. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens, Downtown San Francisco finds itself cloaked in a gentle veil of patchy fog, whispering through the streets and curling around familiar landmarks. The night air is cool, sliding just under 50 degrees, while a soft northeast wind offers a delicate caress, barely disrupting the serene atmosphere. Such conditions invite one to draw on layers, perhaps a light sweater or a cozy jacket, as the city prepares for the ebb and flow of fog that defines its charm.

Looking ahead to Wednesday morning, expect a lingering embrace of fog that may obscure the skyline until late morning, before the sun breaks through, casting a soft glow over the city. With temperatures expected to hover near 58 degrees, then dipping into a tender coolness by afternoon, it will be a day best enjoyed with the comfort of a scarf or a light coat. Consider a stroll along the waterfront or a visit to one of the local cafés where warmth and camaraderie await in a city that hums gently beneath its fog-laden skies. Perhaps, a leisurely walk through the Presidio will provide moments of tranquility, an escape into nature half-hidden by the mysterious marine layer.
